moves.1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5: The advance variation of the Caro-Kann.
moves.3... g6: I usually fianchetto the B on g7, but it is cumbersome and the game is often difficult to defend.
moves.4. Nf3 Bf5 5. c4 Bg7 6. Nc3 Bg4: Don't know if this is best, but trading QB for KN is not all bad.
moves.7. h3 Bxf3 8. Qxf3 e6 9. cxd5 cxd5 10. B: This is why the fianchetto is difficult.  It loses tempos to have to deal with this pin and f6 is always weak.
moves.12... O-O 13. Bxc6 bxc6 14. b4 Qd7 15. R: I gain a tempo since d4 is loose.
moves.17. Bf6 g5: Yet another tempo.  It probably begins to be annoying, but it also helps to uncoordinate the other pieces.
moves.18. Qg4 Bxf6 19. exf6 Qd8: I am going to sneak a pawn--there is no way for Black to defend it.
moves.20. f4 Qxf6 21. fxg5 Qxg5 22. Rf4 Qxg4 2: White Rg4 looks dangerous, but it can only move to one square.
moves.24. b5 cxb5 25. Rxb5 Rac8: Maybe I can sneak my R into his territory.
moves.26... Rcb8: I realized that I might have more play if I exchange his good R.
moves.27. Nb5 a6 28. Nc7 Rxb3 29. axb3 Rb8: Now maybe my R is a little better than his, and my N is more central.
moves.30. Rf4 Rxb3 31. g4 Nd6 32. Nxa6 Rxh3: I managed to sneak another pawn.
I was not sure of the best way to proceed in these close quarters.
moves.36... f5 37. Ne5 Ne4+ 38. Kf3 Rh3+: This forces his R loose and gives me the chance to sneak anothe pawn in a few moves.
moves.39. Kg2 Kxf4 40. Kxh3 Nf2+: A third pawn is going to disappear and Black's task becomes impossible.
